website_summaries.verdict: The clip for this waterproof MP3 player is specially designed to stay in place through flip turns and other underwater moves.
pros: Product comes with some great accessories
Short cord prevents catching and snags
Optional shuffle feature keeps your music in a mix
Supports MP3 and WMA audio formats
Fewer buttons means fewer places for water to enter
cons: May have difficulty playing files from iTunes

website_summaries.verdict: A purpose-built waterproof MP3 player with correspondingly simple controls and reliable playback.
pros: Clips securely to back of swim goggles and includes water-resistant earbuds
8GB storage holds plenty of songs for a swim session
cons: Limited functions, and some, like the shuffle mode setting, are confusing

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised and makes swimming additionally energetic
customer_reviews.text: The SYRYN was easy to add songs to (if one knows how to bulk convert MP4a to MP3 formats), and the storage is far more than most people need unless they plan to swim the South China Sea. The unit works well in the water, but more time is needed to tell. Could live without the promotional hair gel and goggles added...those are wastes for most experienced swimmers *****Update***** Item failed after less than one month of usage. Seal deteriorated, and as a result the controls were shorted and went defective. A real shame because I need a product like this and thought I had a good anwer
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: So I figured crap, I will just download a playlist from my ...
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this to play audiobooks. I was unaware when I ordered it that there was no way of knowing what was playing or what was up next, no screen, just arrow buttons. So I figured crap, I will just download a playlist from my itunes. Oh bother, you have to reformat to mp3. I followed the directions and one hour turned into 3 hours without sucess. I have tried and tried, my version is current but but what pops up is not the same as in the directions and I cannot find anywhere to reformat. So it sits there... Update, merchant contacted me and I returned product, my account was refunded promptly upon receipt of return.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne

customer_reviews.title: Defective out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Total POS. Couldnt transfer files, said the source location didnt exist anymore. ? . Wouldnt maintain connection to PC, kept connecting/removing itself. File was corrupted, I repaired it, corrupted again. Threw it back in box, printed return label. So done with this cheap crap all over Amazon. Really upset I wasted my time on this.
customer_reviews.author: Real Review

customer_reviews.title: don't pause....buy!!! perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous product! Improved over prior version in every way. Can't swim without these, and they will last for several swims. Easy to use, love it! I find I swim longer and put more into it with music. UPDATE a year later: STILL incredible! Lap swimming and water aerobics, used two to three times a week. These rock!!! And far more functional and durable than the first version (differently shaped). Thx for a great product and even better service!
customer_reviews.author: Movin' southTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: 15 uses and dead, however the company has replaced it 1 star to 4!
customer_reviews.text: This item lasted just over a month and died! I swim 3 times a week. so 15 uses. It is not eligible for return after 30 days. it never worked right but at least it kind of worked. now it is frozen and dead :( NOW for the happy side. I called the company and they are replacing it! No problem, really nice and helpful. Amazon was no help but the company was a great help.. one star saddens went to four stars happiness. Thanks Underwater Audio. Underwater Audio Customer Service Department 877-849-0750
customer_reviews.author: sandy

customer_reviews.title: A challenge to use properly
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, I found this product a challenge to use properly. I tried everything suggested in the help documentation and video to get the ear buds to fit well including swapping them out, applying the provided ointment, and adjusting how they are attached to the googles. I tried all of these things multiple times just to make sure it wasn't just a bad experience on one occasion. They just didn't work for me and would consistently fall out while swimming after a few lengths. I'm going to have to buy another set of SwiMP3 which work really well, albeit without the same sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ballard

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try these. Years ago our team worked out in a pool with underwater speakers and I loved swimming to the music. So the good ... This device is simple. I had music files and I just dragged them over. The battery lasts forever. The sound quality was decent. Convenient, just clip to your goggles. The not so good ... One side isn't as loud as the other. Just today, my music started "skipping". I'm suspecting the device might not be as waterproof as it's supposed to be. I'm going to erase and reload all the music and see what happens. Buy again or recommend? We'll see what happens after the above fix.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grandpa loves to listen to music while swimming laps!
customer_reviews.text: I had a tough time converting my iTunes songs to MP3. I tried several converter programs, but was disappointed in their cost and complexity until I discovered Switch. They give a free trial to check it out. My songs converted and were easy to place on my SYRYN Waterproof MP3 Player. I love to listen to music while swimming laps. It makes my workout even more enjoyable. It is convenient to place on the back of the straps of my goggles and the ear buds fit well. I love it; I wish I had discovered this great product sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Brent M.

customer_reviews.title: Good product, must convert Itunes to MP3 format
customer_reviews.text: This works great. The battery lasts a long time, it stays secured to the band on the goggles, and sounds good. The Gel they provide 1 tube of helps keep the buds sealed within the ear, and there are different size fitting to fit big and small ears. The only reason not a 5 star is that it does not accept the standard Itunes format, so you must reformat the songs to MP3 before loading which is a bit tricky (typical Apple) and time consuming. It may be easier with purchased software to convert to MP3, but it can be converted via Itunes if you are patient and have time to research.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: This was a BAD experience from the moment this product arrived at my ...
customer_reviews.text: After more than two weeks I still am unable to load music to this device. Their "customer service" is....lacking. The videos they use to try to show you how to load music are next to worthless. Buy other products that are MUCH more affordable and either easier to use or work. This was a BAD experience from the moment this product arrived at my home. Turned out to the most expensive pair of goggles I have ever owned. Move on to another product.
customer_reviews.author: Dave's Thoughts

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best choice I could have made. My wife swims in a therapy pool 3 times a week and I bought the player to help her pass the time. The player and the headphones work great and they are by far the best value out there. I would highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Bud Hoose

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I have swum hundreds of lap with this player including doing flip turns and am very please with them. I have noticed though that it takes more effort now (I've had them 8 months) to turn them on. If you don't hold the button down long enough they won't come on. I hope the on/off button has not become defective. Turning them off is easy and consistent. Wish they came with better earbuds. I ended up using a pair of tips from another earbud I had, because the ones that came with the player were not large enough for my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander H

customer_reviews.title: 8GB SYRYN MP3 player is great...swimbuds...not so much...
customer_reviews.text: The 8GB SYRYN waterproof MP3 player is great. I have no issues with it. I was able to download music from my laptop and the MP3 player operates as expected. I have not had good luck with the Swimbuds, however. The first pair only lasted a few swims and one side kept cutting out during the swim so no stereo listening. The vendor was very quick to send me another pair of swimbuds which worked for a few swims but are now doing the same thing the first pair did. I'm only getting sound out of one earbud. So...now looking for some waterproof earbuds made for swimming where I can get stereo listening.
customer_reviews.author: Brother John

customer_reviews.title: I love my SYRYN waterproof MP3 player
customer_reviews.text: I love my SYRYN waterproof MP3 player. I do deep water aerobics and it works great. I don't use google, so I just clip it on my bathing suit strap and it's perfect.The sound is clear and I can easily adjust it if necessary. Everything I used before was bulky and hard to change tracks in the water. Every time I use the SYRYN, kids and adults ask me about it. I tell them how to purchase it on Amazon. The 8GB memory with drop and drag make it super easy to create playlists and change them easily. No more searching for directories and other confusing procedures. This was a great purchase and I'm exercising more!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Sharon

customer_reviews.title: This Makes Swimming Awesome For Me!
customer_reviews.text: I get bored while swimming but love swimming for the exercise. I bought this with the hope of loading a book tape. It took a little work to figure out how, from where, in what format etc., but once I did - AMAZING! It loaded an audiobook that I borrowed from the library! I love this so much I just bought a second one for my sister. There was not one issue with these. The sound quality in the water is better than I expected, I listened to 2 chapters while swimming and loved every minute of it!. They give you several different earbud sizes/ options and the battery has lasted a long time.
customer_reviews.author: D- An Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy over all
customer_reviews.text: inise this strictly for lap ssimming. It is comfortable in the ears, has good volume and is easy to use. But, the shuffle feature leaves a lot to he desired. It replayed 2 songs within 15 minutes. Unloaded and reloaded all the music from the device and the same thing happened again. Overall, satisfied so far. Plus, you are not restricted to where you can download music like some other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Good...when they work
customer_reviews.text: They sound great when they work. However, after about 10 uses one of ear buds only intermittently works...which is annoying! For those of us used to Apple products, this is a very basic /old school device that seems poorly designed... but it’s not too difficult to figure out how to add music and use it, and when they work, they’re great. Makes swimming much more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Randy P

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: FANTASTIC! I lap swim 4-5 nights a week for 1-1 1/2 hours. Prior to purchasing the Syryn waterproof MP3 player, I went through 3 competitor MP3 players in a 6 month period. I've had the Syryn for 14 months now, and it hasn't missed a beat! A LOT more storage room than the competitor, a bit more bulky, but the performance of this product far surpasses any waterproof MP3 player I've tried previously. What a GREAT product, and a great price! Would recommend it to any one!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Good underwater MP3 player
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I bought a cheaper waterproof MP3 player and it stopped working the instant it was submerged in the pool. I bought this set to try another MP3 player for swimming laps. Out of the water, the sound is pretty tinny, but when you actually get underwater, they sound really good. I was pleasantly surprised! These are great for swimming or any underwater activity and the price is very good compared to other waterproof players. The player itself is sturdy and light. The headphones stayed in once you get them adjusted.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Kubiak

customer_reviews.title: Perspective of a competition swimmer, 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm a hardcore swimmer. I used to compete and I used to coach, so when I say I swim 500m every weekday understand that those are aggressive laps with flipturns, underwater pulls, etc. Having said that, I just finished my first real workout with this item (having tried waterfii, jbl, and various others to mixed results) and this product beat them all in spectacular fashion. Number of times I had to adjust these during today's swim for any reason was zero! Astonishing. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Paints With Words

customer_reviews.title: Seemed good but died after 3 month for no reason
customer_reviews.text: I have had several waterproof mp3 over the last ten years (speedo aquabeat, nabaji player), and this one left me quite satisfied since i bought it in August 2016. It is easy to use, the sound quality is good, and the earbuds are surprisingly comfortable compared to previous models i had. Unfortunately, it suddenly stopped working only 3 months after i bought it without any apparent reason. Each of my former waterproof players worked for over 4 years without any problems, so i like to think that i am being careful enough to expect this one to have lasted longer than that... Anyway, it sounded good but way over-priced for a 90 days life span.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: can't use after only a month
customer_reviews.text: Works ok for it's intended purpose. Sound quality isn't great, and ear buds fit and project sound oddly, but depending on how audio was recorded to track it can get pretty loud. Headphones and cord were white, not black like in photos, which isn't a deal breaker but I don't care for the white cords as they are more noticeable and make me look like I'm tangled up in cords. My big issue, and reason for writing this review, is my headphone jack connection broke after only a month. Now I can't use it. Disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: redhead

customer_reviews.title: SYRYN MP3 and Earphones Really Work!
customer_reviews.text: While I had my doubts about a water-proof MP3 player and earphones, I was desperate for something to break the boredom of lap swimming (I mean really, how could electronics and water go together? Images of self electrocution came to mind.) But have no fear. I was not electrocuted. And swimming while listening to my favorite songs is fabulous. I also appreciated the affordable price, in comparison with other water-proof listening devices. One suggestion: definitely use the "Fit Goo", which is included with the Syryn MP3 player and earphones....it really helps the phones fit into my ears and keep the water out of my ears.
customer_reviews.author: e.e.

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy swimming again!
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Have been using for about a month. I get bored swimming laps after about 10 minutes, now I swim for about 45. Once I figured these out—the best size ear buds, and for me not using the swim cap over the ears, it works great! They stay in my ears and sound is perfect. I swim about four or five times a week and recharge battery weekly. Probably gets the 10 hrs people say but easier for me to recharge it when restocking my gym bag shampoos and such on Sunday night.
customer_reviews.author: J68

customer_reviews.title: Headphone got stuck in my ear
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this little mp3 player. It is easy to use and the battery life is great. For swimming, it worked but even at the highest volume it still was difficult to hear while swimming laps. The main drawback, however, was when the little waterproof cover of the headphone got stuck in my ear. My husband had to pull it out with tweezers. It totally freaked me out. Now I just use it with regular headphones for running or listening to music but not for swimming because it was not an experience I'd want to repeat!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Good product for swimmer
customer_reviews.text: I love swimming with music on, this is the perfect product. Sound quality could be better but not a big deal breaker to me. Earbud a little bit too small for my ear, could ship with multiple sizes or replaceable earplugs. I only have it for a couple weeks so no comments on durability, seem to me is a concern because this is the 3rd mp3 players I went through in the last 6 months or so. Will keep update.
customer_reviews.author: J.Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Totally changes your swimming experience!
customer_reviews.text: Totally different swimming experience when you have music. I can swim forever now, usually stop because my hands start pruning. Just a heads up, you can't put your music from I tunes on it because it's not an Apple product. So don't buy music from I tunes and think you can put it on this MP3, But Amazon music goes on no problem. Also, watch the Youtube video to set it up. It helps tremendously. And make sure you use the gel with the earbuds or water gets in your ear and you can't hear the music. The gel keeps all water out .
customer_reviews.author: cmc

customer_reviews.title: Very happy customer!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in April of 2016, and enjoyed using it. After 11 months it stopped working. I tried the troubleshooting suggestions on the website, including reformatting the music player, but was not successful. I submitted a claim through Underwater Audio's site, explaining the problem and the steps I took to try to fix it, and requested a replacement. I received a prompt reply, with a return authorization. Within a few days, I had a new music player. I am often asked about it when I am swimming laps at the gym (including today!), and I always rave about it. Now I rave about the wonderful customer service too!
customer_reviews.author: MARNI STRIKS

customer_reviews.title: Good Customer Service Helps Make Up for Low Reliability
customer_reviews.text: When it keeps working, this unit is serviceable. To get a unit which keeps working, however, might take some doing. Fortunately, UA Customer Service is good and there is an online form to fill out when you have to return it. When you fill out the form, they send you a replacement even though they haven't necessarily received your defective unit. That saves time. My first player lasted about 3 months, I think. The second lasted about 7 months, and my current one has lasted about 9 months. You need to know that I don't submerge the player. I do water walking, so my head is above water.
customer_reviews.author: NonnyMus1

customer_reviews.title: Better that expecte for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at all the components that came with this set up. very easy to use and store information on. I have an issue with the earbuds hurting my hears. but I have not tried the other plugs for the ears yet. the Sound it some what tinny as I am used to a set of full sized head phones so these are no where the same as my headphones. but I can live with it for what I am using it for. As far as battery life, I have know Idea yet as I have not used it enough to tell.
customer_reviews.author: zarmo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I’m using for tethered swimming. It works perfect. It’s easy to load songs. I put an hour and a half worth of songs on and easily change my playlist when I’m ready for new ones. I swim for about an hour to an hour and a half so that works perfect. Sound is great. Earbuds are as comfy as any of them are. I wear a swim cap as well and have no problems with ear buds. I clip on my goggles and have no issue. Would absolutely recommend for swimmers!
customer_reviews.author: cmac

customer_reviews.title: Great swimming motivating accessory, Swim with Music a new experience
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for some kind of distraction to make my swimming sessions more enjoyable, now I have my music with me it has made a world of difference, workouts with good motivating music has a different level it makes me go now for longer and stronger. Average BPMs passed from 125 to 140 I'm burning mor cal in the same training session. I'm in my 50ties and I swimming just to be fit from 3 to 5 times a week, very happy with this accessory but I do get anointed with the setting up very time but once everything is in place no problem swimming. I swim between 2000m and 3000m in a time of 1h to 1,5h
customer_reviews.author: SEG1966

customer_reviews.title: I love the product for its price point
customer_reviews.text: Having used this for 4 months, giving for 4 stars for the following reason. Battery does not hold charge for a long time. For example, if I charge the unit today and not use such until two days later, there's no battery left. It only works well when I charge for 20 min right before I use such. Quick charge to use immediately, but not quick charge to hold the same charge for days. Nevertheless, I love the product for its price point. I give 4-star rating because I don't want SYRYN to be falsely comfortable when there is clearly room for improvement. At this price point, we'll be a returning customer.
customer_reviews.author: LEJ1447

customer_reviews.title: Hooooly cow.... what a piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: If you are not into wasting money, do NOT buy this item. Finicky, it stopped responding to any computer I owned within a week of using. Didn't even get a week of swimming in before it stopped allowing me to add / remove files via USB. Save your money and spend it on something quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ablaut "Buddy" Reduplication

customer_reviews.title: Good waterproof MP3 player
customer_reviews.text: Used this a couple of times now and can honestly say it is great. Sound is clear (but make sure you size the earbuds to your ears correctly first with the supplied sizes).to prevent water leaking in. Still working through the first charge and am at about 5 hours use so far with no issues. The short earbud cable works well, although to stop the buds coming out during a racing turn I had to pass the cable under the goggle strap, but that wasn't an issue once I worked out the best way of doing it. All in all a great waterproof MP3 player.
customer_reviews.author: PBarrington

customer_reviews.title: HARD TO MANIPULATE  AND POOR QUALITY COMPARED TO IPOD
customer_reviews.text: wHEN aPPLE DECIDED TO ELIMINATE ITUNES i'M PRETTY MUCH STUCK. i ORDERED SYRYN AS A BACKUP AND IT WAS SO TIME CONSUMING CHANGING ALL MY ITUNES TO THE REQUIRED FORMAT FOR SYRYN. aLSO CUMBERSOME COMPARED TO THE sHUFFLE AND VERY POOR BATTERY LIFE. aLL IN ALL A WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.author: nmk8274

customer_reviews.title: It works fine!
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted to listen to music while doing laps, and this Syryn does indeed do that. While I also wore the cap, sometimes the ear buds fall out of my ear, and I just stop to put it back in. There are a set of these buds of different sizes that one can choose from. Overall, I am very satisfied. Also loading the mp3 format music was not hard from my iMac - just had to convert some of my files (in iTunes) from ACC to mp3 format, before dragging the folder to the Syryn icon.
customer_reviews.author: jbro141

customer_reviews.title: why four stars?
customer_reviews.text: this MP3 player works well and as advertised. the reason i give it four rather than 5 stars is simply because the software design for transferring audio files to the player is ho-hum. it requires your to drag and drop files in the order you want to listen to them. i am obviously spoiled by the ease of the apple sync to other apple products, but the transfer protocol for this device is a bit tedious. other than that, no complaints whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: avid reader

customer_reviews.title: I don't use this for swimming
customer_reviews.text: I buy this mp3 player for my developmentally disabled son to use to listen to music. It has a very simple interface and it can withstand a certain amount of abuse. The only complaint I have is the control button cover tends to peel off after a few months. I have bought 4 of them so far.
customer_reviews.author: Francine Long

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, and design is good. If you are looking for great sound from the headphones, these are not going to provide that. Sound quality is just ok. I wasn't expecting anything fantastic for the cost and the fact that it's waterproof. Sounds better when submerged vs. above water, so you do get some fluctuation in sound going from above to below water level. I had the swimp3 underwater music player previously, and I like this one better. Overall it does what it should, and is easy to use. I would buy it again. Nice to have music while swimming laps for sure!
customer_reviews.author: chad lorenz

customer_reviews.title: Finally a swim mp3 that works consistently!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used these twice, but so far, they’re flawless. This is the 3rd swim mp3 I purchased. The others were useless. These stay in well and the sound is good. I hesitated on the swim cap to go with them, but I’m now very glad I purchased it was well. It helps keep the earbuds firmly in place without pushing them too hard into the ear, as well as keeping excess water out. The entertainment as I swam allowed me to easily increase my workout from 1/2 mile to 1 mile. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Scarton

customer_reviews.title: Earbuds Painful with Bathing Cap
customer_reviews.text: I've had 2 MP3 players for the pool so far. This one works great. It's very simple. I gave them a 3 because my issue is with the earbud comfort. I wear a bathing cap and goggles. The earbuds stay in pretty well but they are painful. I've tried all of the parts that come with the kit. The smallest are the least painful for me. I'll adjust, they will be great, then I start to swim and the sound is muffled. So I'm constantly adjusting them. Not sure how sturdy they would be without the bathing cap to hold them in.
customer_reviews.author: Leslee K.

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love!! If you swim, you need these in your life!!!
customer_reviews.text: Finally made it out to the pool to swim! They totally exceeded my expectations! Sound was nice and volume was good! They didn't fall out, not even once! Plus they came with some "goo" to help them stay, but I didn't use it, but I didn't need it anyways! Not gonna lie, I had bought some expensive ones at Best Buy and they sucked and I couldn't figure out how to use them, but this was super easy to use and load up. Clipped on my goggles and worked amazing! Can't wait to use em again tomorrow and the next season coming up!! So worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Janie C.

customer_reviews.title: Great MP3 for swimming
customer_reviews.text: It worked perfectly. I followed instructions (it has a picture guide) After a month of using it (swim a couple days out of the week) The sound got muffled. It seems the earphones got broken or ruined? I made sure for it to not get wet on the ear piece part.I haven't used it for a week and it just happened to get muffled. The sound will play clearly on regular earphones so I pinpoint the problem to the earphones. Update: Seller has reached me out to troubleshoot earphones. All I had to do was clean out earpiece because sometimes water drop may go inside and muffle earphone. It works perfectly now. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Linda and Jared

customer_reviews.title: Worked great till they didnt!
customer_reviews.text: Only used these for swimming laps, a couple of dozen times over a couple years or so (dont swim laps that often) and one day they just stopped working...wouldn't charge or connect to my desktop (device corrupted) Tried all the reset fixes I found online but no go. Called Syryn but, though they were nice about it, out of warranty so out of luck! good product, but not very durable...should last more than a few uses....
customer_reviews.author: Middle of Nowhere

customer_reviews.title: Surprised they work well
customer_reviews.text: I did not have any expectations of underwater MP3 players working but they are surprising decent. Really neat hearing music underwater with respectable quality. I do not wear a swim cap so they do come off sometimes when i am doing sprint laps but otherwise stay in nicely. I did give up trying to put music on them from my MAC and iTunes. You have to convert the music . So I use a PC and that simplified it a bit. Little hard getting the shuffle to work. Because the on off button is also the shuffle button. Overall makes swimming more fun. Just do not try to sing along to the songs...
customer_reviews.author: Dom

customer_reviews.title: sound quality is wonderful
customer_reviews.text: The sound is fantastic both under and above water. The length of the earbud wires is perfect for swimming. The buds stay in ear well. Only thing that I don't like about it is my inability to create an organized playlist. It is unintuitive for organizing music. I think I recall reading that you need to download additional softwear to do so? I don't know. I gave up on that part. Would highly recommend based on sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Super impressed with the quality and value here
customer_reviews.text: Super impressed with the quality and value here... well designed, controls are easy to use while clipped to your goggles... (including goggles is a bit silly). Headphones are decent. Having 8 GB is great. I bought these while I was awaiting a warranty replacement for a waterproof ipod shuffle... and these are so good, I haven't even used my new ipod shuffle... If you swim and need some waterproof music, get these!
customer_reviews.author: James A. Moffitt

customer_reviews.title: Incredible product with super good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I swim 4 to 6 days a week an average of hours, this SYRYN mp3 is incredible, I enjoy more my swimming while I listen my music with a great quality sound. The battery life is very long so i don't have to be worry about being with no music while I'm training. The size of the MP3 is just right, it is comfortably placed in the googles at the back of my head and as the headphones cord is short you are not dealing whit cord interfering with your swimming. Really enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Iniani Cardenas

customer_reviews.title: Now That's Service
customer_reviews.text: Really liked the player but was having problems with one of the earbuds. Contacted customer service. No problems: a new set of headphones was sent out and received a few days later. The player is very basic but fits my needs for my water aerobics. Unit clips on to my swimsuit strap. I don't even know it's there. This company is definitely on my positive list for product and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Joanzy

customer_reviews.title: ... you get use to the controls they are really easy to use without even looking
customer_reviews.text: Small compact with huge sound and once you get use to the controls they are really easy to use without even looking. I love it and it has made my deep water aerobic workouts even more enjoyable. Now all I have to do is get more music! ;--) Dec 2016 One earbud quit working they offered a one time free replacement for the earphones.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and works!!!
customer_reviews.text: This works very well. The instructions are clear and this 65-year-old user was able to use the player, load audiobooks on to it, and hear them during water aerobics. Amazing! I'd tried another player and it was nothing but problems. The buttons are big enough on this one to be able to feel them in the pool (since I don't have my glasses on). So far, I've worn a swim hat to help hold the ear plugs in, but I'm getting ready to experiment with the different sizes. I swam some laps with the MP3 player and headphones and it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth J

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VALUE...COMPLETELY WATERPROOF...GREAT FOR SWIMMING....EASY TO TRANSFER FILES!
customer_reviews.text: Finally got to use today! After purchasing 3 other products that did not live up to being water proof..this one IS WATERPROOF! The headset extension has a short in it and will request a replacement however when headset is plugged directly into the unit it worked perfect. Volume is not super high...but is enough to block out most sounds. Great value for the price...eventually may replace earphones with higher quality for higher volume but these get the job done and make swimming fun! Easy to use drag and drop file transfer on WIN 8.2. Packaging was great. Guup worked well no problems with earbuds falling out.
customer_reviews.author: Christina C.

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is good and the swim googles are descent
customer_reviews.text: Product works exactly as advertised. The important factor is that I’m able to listen to music while doing laps. And this system allows me to do that. Sound quality is good and the swim googles are descent. Ear buds do a pretty good job of keeping water out of your ears. I’ve had a couple of instances where I had to shack water out of the ear bud to get full sound back, but if you use the silicon, that comes with the package, it can help prevent this from happening. Overall, very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery J. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and drowns out loud kids
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about how good these would actually be. So I bought one and loved it so much, I ended up buying 2 more. My wife and kid now have their own pair as well. The sound is so clear that I was astonished. The only time the sound drowns out is when you go from above water and down below fully submerged. It doesn't bother me at all. It turned out to make swimming more enjoyable and works great doing flip turns and all. I even tried this with snorkeling and it worked great. The sound is so good it blocks out the kids screaming and so forth. Thank you so much.
customer_reviews.author: RVOnTheWayside

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for a reliable mp3 player...and waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: The Syryn mp3 player has worked perfectly while swimming laps. The primary criticism of this player is that you cannot fast forward or rewind a track. (You can advance or move back a track.) I was not interesting in spending almost $200 on a 2GB iPod, so this inconvenience is well worth the savings. I have had no issues with the Syryn. Load files just like you would with a jump/flash drive. (I have not used the earbuds or goggles...I purchased the Hydroactive waterproof headphones, which are great, and already had some Speedo goggles.)
customer_reviews.author: J. Black

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Great price
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been easy to use. I got a little scared the first time I went into the water but I was able to figure it out. It said I needed to load songs onto it but I had already done that. I reset it by holding down a few buttons and when it turned back on I was doing multiple laps listening to great music. There are lots of ear pieces to find a better fit. I had no issues with the chords or the tips falling out.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo

customer_reviews.title: Makes doing laps not boring
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for two weeks now and have had no problems. It didn't die nor did it stop playing while swimming. One caveat is that it's only good for swimming laps. The sound gets muffled if you put your head more than a few inches under water. Also, it would be nice if the swimbuds had a L and R labeling as I often get confused about which bud is for which ear. It took me a little while to be able to put the swimbuds in without them coming off while swimming. The instructions to put them in could be more clear. Other than that, I am super happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: NK

customer_reviews.title: quite good
customer_reviews.text: it's been a week, i'm using it every day for an hour in the pool. the quality of sound is not satisfied, but i didnt expect that from the first. what i was concerned is a durability in the water, and so far so good. if someone has curiosity about the materials looks like some kind of grease in the socket and jacks, they said it's applied on purpose for increasing durabilitiy in the water. but im still worried about a leaking from around the socket, so i made myself a piece of rubber film like 4th picture, it seems sealed quite good :) thanks for reading my broken english review.
customer_reviews.author: Jeongmin Hwang

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome player
customer_reviews.text: I really like the ease of use of this product. It is easy to load the files and charge the item for use. When swimming the earbuds work perfectly and the volume button is easy to manage for hearing at the volume you prefer. The cord length from the earbuds to the player is perfect for me. It is easy to skip a song or repeat a playlist. I use this feature for timing for leisure laps, by making a playlist of 35 or 45 mins and swim until the song list goes back to the beginning. Pretty awesome player, so I am a satisfied customer. I would recommend this player.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This player is perfect! It’s lightweight so doesn’t cause any problems while swimming. Plenty of songs. I do everything with music so It was hard for me to finish my cardio swim. This fixed my problem! And it’s so much cheaper than iPod. Only had it a short while but I have used it approx 30min a day for a week and haven’t needed to charge it. So far so good! I haven’t used any of the other products in the package so I can’t comment on those. Only thing that stinks is that now I have another type of charger to add to my collection.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly W

customer_reviews.title: Amazing swim mp3
customer_reviews.text: I am a regular swimmer in a local PWN lake that gets colder as we move into autumn (the water should hit about 48 degrees by this weekend). I LOVE this player. I get lost in the music. The sound is good....I've done 2-1/2 hr swims without a break in bliss. I use faster songs for sprint workouts between instrumentals for peaceful recovery. You can't beat the cost. I've had 2 FINIS, the iPod Shuffle and this beats all of them.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy L Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this SYRYN!!! I swim laps and ti makes it so much more enjoyable to listen to my music. I can plan to listen to as many songs as I want based on the time limit I want to swim without having to keep looking at the clock. I bought the complete package, so it came with the gel to keep water out of my ears. They work GREAT!! A member at the YMCA suggested them.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia L. Lanfear

customer_reviews.title: Swimmers Ear Gear
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Shape is a bit cumbersome but generally good. The biggest issue is that it is easy to leave on after charging but that's more me than the device though the light is a bit hard to see. Another issue is trying to keep the water from seeping into your ear which muffles the sound. They do provide different sizes of plugs (plug adapters). It seems to be the best thing out there made specifically for the water. If this fails I may try an iPod Mini filled with dielectric grease though that doesn't seem like a great solution.
customer_reviews.author: Another Mike

customer_reviews.title: So Far--They're Great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using the set for swimming my daily laps. I've wanted something like this for years. The sound is great. I've used them now for almost 3 weeks, swimming for about half an hour 5 days/week. I was especially pleased with the phone assistance they offer. I wasn't able to transfer my music to the set, but when I called the company, the lady who answered very patiently walked me through the steps. I have already recommended the headset to the life guard on duty who asked me about them.
customer_reviews.author: Mary C.

customer_reviews.title: Nifty gadget for swimming with audio
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical this would live up to its reviews but I am impressed so far with this little device to bring audio to your swimming workouts. You might need to adjust the fit during rests but it holds up well otherwise. The audio is quality isnt Bose but is decent enough for the purpose. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Michael Clinton

customer_reviews.title: This product works great for me
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This product works great for me. But I really try to take care of it as well. I have been delicate with it in the water by not pressing the buttons so hard, and I try to keep the headphone insert fully fitted in the aux port so water will not get into the unit while I am swimming. With these things in mind, my unit has not broken for numerous lap swims. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: These are outstanding. To be able to listen to music while swimming for $60 is a steal. The headphones are designed to be worn underwater. I would not recommend this player to be used above the water. You can't pick and choose what you want to hear but you can use these in the water so that makes up for that, I use scuffle so I always have my own radio station with me while I swim.Sound quality is great and they do get loud enough. 8 gb is plenty of storage.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a 2gb iPod shuffle that started failing due to battery usage. Decided to try this because it's half the price. Definitely worth it. It's larger and I can feel it at the back of my swim cap at times (I just turn it sideways). Not perfectly intuitive while swimming, but easy to change the volume/advance tracks. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: atlantamoi

customer_reviews.title: Average product - Could have improvements
customer_reviews.text: I'd been using this product for a couple of weeks. For the price, is not bad and make it's function, but I'd spend a bit more and get a better one. Earbuds are not very comfortable... go too deep into the ears and feel like a little stabby, but if you don't swim more than 1h is bearable. Sound is ok but wish it to be a little louder (you can't manage it). And finally sound sometimes go on and off in some sides, it depends if the earbud moves a bit... So, overall, I'll go for another one more sturdy, but if budget issues, this will make its function average.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use / Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a great price. The MP3 player hooks up swiftly to any computer as long as you have a USB port. Music downloads very easily. (If you have Apple music, you have to convert it to MP3 version first.) Headphones fit well and work well and sound great. Fantastic to have music while swimming laps. The MP3 player is easy and intuitive to use while in the water -- not a lot of button pushes to get music going or stopped or advanced. Seller, Underwater Audio, is great and helpful if required. I was not paid/compensated/etc. for this review.
customer_reviews.author: TheTimbersGuys

customer_reviews.title: The battery dies--just stops working
customer_reviews.text: I have tried these units, 6 different times. They are wonderful until they simply stop working. They won't charge. They won't play. They die and will not recharge. They are good for 2-4 months and then just stop. Buy something else. Don't waste your money. It is frustrating to go to the pool, and then the thing dies. Happens over and over again. What a disappointment. And it is a wonder to me that the manufacturer does not fix this fatal flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Miller

customer_reviews.title: Player works as advertised. Nice.
customer_reviews.text: Player stayed in my goggles. I had to not use iTunes to get music as we already had the music in ASC and didn't want extra but I was able to reimport and convert music outside of iTunes. The ear goo actually works well and is kind of necessary for buds to stay in and play well. Sound quality for water quite good. Makes swimming laps easier.
customer_reviews.author: C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I've been swimming laps at the gym and have been so bored doing it. I saw someone with an Apple waterproof mp3 player and thought that's just what I needed. When I went shopping it for, I saw that the prices were over $124. I didn't think I needed it that badly. Then I found this at a much more affordable price. The sound is great and the earphones keep the water out of my ears. I've put vaseline on the earbuds, as I read many other people say to do, and it helps. I would definitely recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Linda B

customer_reviews.title: What a bust
customer_reviews.text: Failed to work straight out of the box. I followed the directions per the videos at underwater audio, whom sells this item through amazon. Nothing. Windows does not recognize the device. I continued on to reset the device and now it won't even turn on. I was really looking forward to using this, but I guess I will learn to do laps without music!!! VERY disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: C.J.

customer_reviews.title: Music constantly skips
customer_reviews.text: I've had issues loading music since I got this. My computer often gives me an error when loading music to the device. Once I've finally been able to load the music, the quality is awful. I can usually get the song to play correctly once or twice, but then the music and device start skipping and everything is jumbled. I would not purchase this product. It performs very poorly.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Water sports are much more fun with this gadget.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for water aerobics, swimming and the gym. It is awesome. Music I want without messing with my phone. If teaching water aerobics I can just plug it into speakers for playlists. My friends love it and bought their own. There's nothing I dislike about it. I go through the headphones alot because I use it so much. The company is really attentive and keeps the customers happy if an issue arises. Love that they send emails and have playlists you can download. It's a great device. Thanks, Scott and underwater audio.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service and now after THREE YEARS of use: perfect
customer_reviews.text: When it works, all is fine! However while it always charged using the supplied audio- usb cable ... it sometimes was not recognized by the computer when I tried to download music/ podcasts. when I waited long enough it would be suddenly appear on my computer screen I called the company and their rep was quick to send me a new SYRYN ( no charge)... this one works well so far I must commend the customer service staff...quick to pick up the phone and very helpful. Now after 3 years of use works well and makes swimming laps fun!
customer_reviews.author: patricia samwick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome portable player for swimming
customer_reviews.text: This works great and the ear buds stay in my ears better than regular ear plugs. It really helps me to concentrate on my swimming and makes the experience so much more enjoyable, being able to play my music. The sound is clear and strong. It is a perfect blend of treble and bass. I highly recommend this to anyone who wants to listen to music while that swim!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Experience so far
customer_reviews.text: One day in, it took me 2 days to figure out sync instructions for music from my PC to the product. Their instructions are WRONG for a PC file transfer/sync. Then I could not hear anything once I got files on the MP3 Player. Instructions were good in telling me they set the sound at "0" when shipping. Once I turned sound up, bingo. Used them in the pool for the first time yesterday. Delightful. Very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Grim

customer_reviews.title: Great for swimming laps!
customer_reviews.text: Love this!! Makes swimming laps so much more fun. I can't believe it works under water so well. Of course there's not great bass or anything, but honestly it plays music UNDER WATER!! What more can you ask for?! I highly recommend these if you enjoy swimming laps and want to have more fun. Or maybe even if you want to listen to music in the shower or bath.
customer_reviews.author: Gursharon

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to use. Putting music on is no different than putting on a storage card. The performance exceeded my expectations honestly. It was so wonderful to get lost in music for a 1 hour swim vs counting laps. Now I count songs. The sound is very good and with following the instructions they also block water and stay put. I even wear them on my bike, very light and short cord it hooks well on my helmet chinstrap. Very pleased with this!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Larson

customer_reviews.title: Wife is very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: She has been using them for about 3 weeks now listening to podcasts as she swims. It is easy to load up the podcasts from my mac and to delete old ones. It appears like a thumb drive would. She has had no problems with the pool water hurting the unit or ear buds. She's not over technical so if she finds it easy to use, then you should, too.
customer_reviews.author: caprae

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof, Good Quality Sound and Hassle-Free--The SYRYN Headphones and MP3 Player Work for Me
customer_reviews.text: I've been swimming with thefor a couple of weeks now. I usually swim for at least an hour at a pretty good clip. I love that the swimbuds stay put and the MP3 player sound is clear. The MP3 player fits onto my goggle strap at the back of my head and I tuck the short cord under the strap too...both stay out of my way. Having music always helps my workout--especially when doing laps in the pool--I've even started wearing this MP3 player when I'm cycling because of how much I sweat. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: MplsCurlyGirl

customer_reviews.title: READ THIS B4 U BUY
customer_reviews.text: This mp3 player+ headphones combo work really well. The sound is great and they have increased my swimming distance by more than 2x since I bought them. Before I would just get bored as I swam and it would always make me quite early after only 10 laps. The first time I put these I on swam 20 laps. Ive never swam that far before. The sound quality is great and the headphones have 3 sets of removable ear pieces so you can ensure that water does not get in your ears. Worth every cent. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Fidelity
customer_reviews.text: I have owned and found wanting Apple Shuffle adapted water proof swimming devices. The Swimbud Flip Headphones come with very effective ear buds that do not fall out when swimming laps and the music has fantastic fidelity. Transferring files from my computer was a simple drag and drop. This product is built to last unlike my earlier experience.
customer_reviews.author: MJF

customer_reviews.title: Glad I have this!
customer_reviews.text: This device makes my water workouts far more enjoyable and helps in making them far more aggressive as well! Good battery life and amount of music it can hold. Giving a 4 star rather 5 star review because the device is not very intuitive in how to use. Unless you have the directions with you in the pool, the "how to" can be a little confusing, i.e. volume adjustment. Overall good product, I just need to memorize all the codes...flashing blue, solid red, combination of buttons to achieve what I want. I am sure it will get better.
customer_reviews.author: DJB8467

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Now, before I begin, I am a 30 something that just finished an online graduate degree, so I am fairly good with technology. Once I received this piece of crap, after many interactions with customer support, it had to be reset before it could even be used (not included on instructions, had to be sent links with lengthy steps to accomplish). Finally got MP3 files loaded on it, excited to try. Then it would not hold a charge, turn on, or play any MP3 files. The light would turn on, start flashing, and then it would shut off. Again, more interactions with customer service with no help. Returned it as soon as I could!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Steiner

customer_reviews.title: Just Terrific!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this. Had a shuffle years ago in a H2O audio waterproof case. But after I ripped an earpiece cord I went looking to replace it. The cases are quite expensive and invalidate any warranty on an Apple product. This is just great. If you check online it is easy to transfer ITunes and Audible Books to it. Works as describes, charges easily, and can use regular headphones when not in the water. As a matter of fact don't use the waterproof earphones on land - they are more hassle and costly to replace. Sound is just great. Wonderful to own and enjoy a well-made and reasonably-priced product. Be safe.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned

customer_reviews.title: Let’s start with bad things...... Hmmm there is none
customer_reviews.text: Let’s start with bad things...... Hmmm there is none. I am lap free style swimmer and swim 3-4 times a week. After 15-20 laps I start to get a bit bored (usually I swim about a mile) but since I started to use this SYRYN player my mood changes a lot. The sound is very good, headphones seal awesome and goggles are better than lots of brand names. To apple lovers: you pay $100.00 for the name and $40.00 for 2gb storage and no googles For SYRYN you pay (may be) $20.00 for the name and $40.00 for 8gb storage and very good goggles
customer_reviews.author: MIRSAD KADIC

customer_reviews.title: I am 100% satisfied with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the 8 GB Syryn with swimbuds headphones to help with the boredom of my swim lap workouts. I am 100% satisfied with my purchase. The Syryn has eliminated the tedium of my mile-long swim workouts. About 2 days after I started using the Syryn, one of the earbuds stopped working. I contacted Underwater Audio and they immediately sent me a new set of earbuds. I am pleased with my purchase and this company, and I would definitely order from them again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Stout

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed because I thought Amazon sold high quality stuff
customer_reviews.text: What a ripoff. It worked for less than 2 months and then it malfunctioned under normal use about twice a week. It kept skipping from song to song by itself and I couldn't adjust the volume. Plus when I asked to return it they said anything over 30 days is not guaranteed and they could not say exactly how much I would get. If you want to pay this much for a product that works less than 2 months go ahead. Very disappointed because I thought Amazon sold high quality stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Ruthie

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly, easy solution
customer_reviews.text: Great solution for music while swimming. Have used for a month for about 60 minutes/twice a week. It does require mp3 files -- which require a bit of work if you are transferring music from itunes. However, both apple support and mp3 player have clear, easy instructions how to to do. Overall pretty straightforward. The player is small which is great -- and the tradeoff is you have to learn how to navigate the controls -- such as linear play versus shuffle. I found everything to work as instructions indicated -- you just have to remember how to do the different things.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I bought this waterproof mp3 player a little over 8 months ago and have used it in the pool at least 3X a week for 75-90 minutes each time. At that rate I tend to get about 8 uses before I have to recharge. It holds a lot of music--enough I don't get bored anyway. My only wish for it would be a way to easily re-order the songs to vary playback. Shuffle works but it's not always "no repeat". All in all, I'd buy this again for using in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: books_everywhere

customer_reviews.title: I love mine for water workouts!
customer_reviews.text: I love this small waterproof MP3 player for my swimming pool workouts. It’s very affordable & came with ear buds on a short cord with an optional extender, USB charge cord, swim goggles & 2 related trial size products. It clips on to my swim suit & has Good sound quality It was easy to transfer my music from ITunes. I haven’t re-charged it yet, but my mom has one & hasn’t had to re-charge yet after quite a few uses. This player will be enjoyable at the pool & beach.
customer_reviews.author: Melly

customer_reviews.title: It makes training in the pool enjoyable.
customer_reviews.text: I like it alot I just wish I could import mp4 directly. It took me a little while to figure out how to convert it to an mp3 and save it to this unit on iTunes but once I did it was pretty easy. It works well and sounds nice. I have a few hundred songs on it and it seems like I have already heard the same song a few times in just 4 times using it but it's easy to reach back and skip a song. Overall I like it and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: James J. Torres

customer_reviews.title: Warming up to it
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of trouble right out of the box. I couldn't delete files. Attempting to restore it using the instructions on the site bricked it for awhile. Eventually, I realized that it is very temperamental about which USB port is used. If you're having trouble, try another port. I wish this info was on the support site.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Died after 3rd use
customer_reviews.text: This device worked wonderfully three times, transforming the experience of an hour's swim. Then it died. Amazon, to its credit, is shipping a new device immediately. If it proves to be more durable, I'll update this review. Buyers might like to know that the enclosed manual gives three sets of instructions, each more drastic than the one before, on what to do if the unit crashes or appears dead. That's not reassuring. In any case, none of them did any good for my unit.
customer_reviews.author: Badger

customer_reviews.title: I love the fact that I can download a book from ...
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat this waterproof device for the price! I've been using it for 3 months now and my daily hour swim goes by much faster now. I love the fact that I can download a book from Overdrive to listen to an audio book for free. When I shuffle music it is a bit redundant and doesn't go through the music that I have downloaded very well---always going back to previously played songs. Other then that, it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Betts

customer_reviews.title: Happy!
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled at how easy it is to download music to this. Too bad the sweet-looking iPod Shuffle didn't work out. I didn't want to fuss trying to get iTunes so it was very frustrating. The SYRYN was also a lot less expensive. I've been using this for awhile now to pace my pool noodle laps and am quite happy. I don't use the earbuds that came with it (don't like earbuds) but another set that came with a waterproof pouch I had bought previously. Yes, it has earbuds attached to a holder that hooks around the ear, but I doubt if anyone can come up with an on-the-ear design that is waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: MairC

product_meta.title: Swimbuds Flip Headphones and 8 GB SYRYN Waterproof MP3 Player with Shuffle Feature
feature_bullets: Stay Active & Be Safe - We are ecstatic that pools have begun to reopen around the country. Swimming with music is a great way to shake off the quarantine blues!

Easy to Use Shuffle Mode - Three large, tactile buttons enable you to easily operate the SYRYN mid stroke. Engage the onboard shuffle feature while you swim to instantly refresh your favorite playlists on the fly

Timeless Design and Functionality - Not everyone wants another complicated gizmo or tethered smartwatch. The SYRYN draws from the compact form and function of players' past, without tying you to a smart phone like other compact devices today.

100% Waterproof (IPX8) - The SYRYN is built for swimmers and protected by a 1-year warranty against manufacturer defects! It is fully submersible and can withstand sustained pressure up to 10 feet below the surface.
Superb battery life & plenty of storage - Get 10 hours of real playback time from a single charge + 8Gb of storage is enough for up to 2,000 of your favorite songs in MP3 or WMA format.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,232 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
